item.title: SK Telecom says malware breach lasted 3 years, impacted 27 million numbers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SK Telecom says that a recently disclosed cybersecurity incident in April, first occurred all the way back in 2022, ultimately exposing the USIM data of 27 million subscribers. [...]

item.title: Hazy Hawk gang exploits DNS misconfigs to hijack trusted domains
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor named 'Hazy Hawk' has been using DNS CNAME hijacking to hijack abandoned cloud endpoints of domains belonging to trusted organizations and incorporate them in large-scale scam delivery and traffic distribution systems (TDS). [...]

item.title: RVTools hit in supply chain attack to deliver Bumblebee malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The official website for the RVTools VMware management tool was taken offline in what appears to be a supply chain attack that distributed a trojanized installer to drop the Bumblebee malware loader on users' machines. [...]

item.title: Service desks are under attack: What can you do about it?
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Service desks are on the front lines of defense—and attackers know it. Attackers are using social engineering attacks to trick agents into changing passwords, disabling MFA, and granting access. Learn more from Specops Software on how to secure your service desk. [...]

item.title: OpenAI plans to combine multiple models into GPT-5
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is planning to combine multiple products (features or models) into its next foundational model, which is called GPT-5. [...]

item.title: Fake KeePass password manager leads to ESXi ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Threat actors have been distributing trojanized versions of the KeePass password manager for at least eight months to install Cobalt Strike beacons, steal credentials, and ultimately, deploy ransomware on the breached network. [...]

item.title: O2 UK patches bug leaking mobile user location from call metadata
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A flaw in O2 UK's implementation of VoLTE and WiFi Calling technologies could allow anyone to expose the general location of a person and other identifiers by calling the target. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 emergency updates fix BitLocker recovery issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released out-of-band updates to fix a known issue causing Windows 10 systems to boot into BitLocker recovery after installing the May 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: Arla Foods confirms cyberattack disrupts production, causes delays
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Arla Foods has confirmed to BleepingComputer that it was targeted by a cyberattack that has disrupted its production operations. [...]

item.title: Microsoft unveils Windows AI Foundry for AI-powered PC apps
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft is replacing 'Copilot Runtime' with Windows AI Foundry to help developers build, experiment, and reach users with AI experiences in their apps. [...]

item.title: Microsoft confirms new "Advanced" Settings for Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: At the Build 2025 developer conference, Microsoft announced a new 'Advanced Settings' feature to help users and developers personalize the OS experience. [...]

item.title: Microsoft open-sources Windows Subsystem for Linux at Build 2025
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has open-sourced the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), making its source code available on GitHub, except for a few components that are part of Windows. [...]

item.title: UK Legal Aid Agency confirms applicant data stolen in data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The United Kingdom's Legal Aid Agency (LAA) has confirmed that a recent cyberattack is more serious than first believed, with hackers stealing a large trove of sensitive applicant data in a data breach. [...]

item.title: Mozilla fixes Firefox zero-days exploited at hacking contest
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Mozilla released emergency security updates to address two Firefox zero-day vulnerabilities demonstrated in the recent Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking competition. [...]
